items.name: Box Util
items.summary: This mod is the first iteration of the translation of a Fossic mod of the same name.
items.description:
This mod is the first iteration of the translation of a Fossic mod of the same name. 

This mod adds a multitude of ships to the game alongside an immense amount of mobile suits and Gundams from the Gundam universe in the style of ArmaArmatura's already existing ones.

It is currently not completely finished. There is still many things which will be fixed in due time but through all testing there should be no completely fatal errors. Some descriptions cannot be translated without direct access to the source code of the mod which we do not currently have and will be working on in due time.

This is a project being undertaken by me as a tester, <@343514131250544651>, <@683958546878169123>  and of course the mod maker themselves <@436353727323176960> who has done an amazing job at shaping and keeping this mod up in the far away land of Fossic.

There will be updates to this in future as we improve the translation and more content comes out for the mod itself. If you encounter any fatal crashes related to this mod please relay it to Me, Legion or James, as it is likely an issue in translation somewhere and not a result of the original mod. We will take a look.

This mod includes... other things, too, such as multiple rather interesting bounties which is the primary way of aquiring the other ships added by the mod.

items.name: ARSWP 0.9c
items.summary:
Are all those hundreds of "ship and weapon pack" on the forum/discord not enough for you? I got you covered my man. And here you'll see some ships and guess what? some weapons, especially a bunch of reloadable missiles that I really think is lacking in vanilla. Most of them are not so powerful (I hope) but they'll shine in longer engagements. I'm also adding weapons to fill the range gap that is huge in vanilla. There's a bunch of 900su mediums and 1000su larges...
 changelog:
items.description:
Are all those hundreds of "ship and weapon pack" on the forum/discord not enough for you? I got you covered my man. And here you'll see some ships and guess what? some weapons, especially a bunch of reloadable missiles that I really think is lacking in vanilla. Most of them are not so powerful (I hope) but they'll shine in longer engagements. I'm also adding weapons to fill the range gap that is huge in vanilla. There's a bunch of 900su mediums and 1000su larges...
 changelog:
`weapons:
leveler/bertha: halved the dmg per shot, but added a breach effect. It's now a more specialized armor cracker as the effect wont deal extra dmg to shield or hull.
tyrfing: dmg per shot 300 -> 400, dmg per second was kept the same.
scorpion: nerfed flux/shot and overall accuracy.
demohammer: nerfex flux/shot.
mallet: nerfed the dmg to 2000 and made it cheaper to install.
new weapon Heavy Swarmer: large Swarmer with an autoforge and very low op cost.

wings:
ascalon: reduced tachlance range and dmg. 
talismans: reduced fighter per wing by one and made them cheaper.
thunderbolts: nerfed its toughness overall, they were way to strong.
LG variant: now uses a limited ammo HE cannon and a pair of Gazer DEMS. System changed to a single use teleport... yes it will teleport directly to the target when ordered to engage.

ships:
gunther(LG): system changed to a longer range (but longer cooldown) phase skimmer.
falcon(LG prototype): added energy bolt coherer.
Tirpitz(baseline):  swapped the builtin talons for talismans.
Spee(baseline: DP 35 -> 30.
Spee(P): 100 less armor, 10 more topspeed (and a bit more maneuverability).`

**will break your save if you have V0.9 or lower installed, V09b to V09c is safe**

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**
items.description:
**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Requires MagicLib and LazyLib. LunaLib is required to use LunaSettings (though Settings.editme still works)

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Ability to automate tags via automatic customizable suggested tags and fleet-wide weapon-composition based tags
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes in advanced mode
- Customize most aspects of the mod through LunaLib settings
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.

```
To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.
Example integration code: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-symbiotic-void-creatures/blob/main/src/tecrys/svc/hullmods/BGECarapace.kt#L98
```

Videos:
AGC 1.15 Showcase: https://youtu.be/N5SIRMo7Pxc
AGC in 60s: https://youtu.be/2T3xNqy2HQA

Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

items.name: Aegis Combat System v0.5.0
items.summary:
A weapon mod that introduces area defense missiles that behave like the RIMs with the coordination under the Aegis Combat System of the US Navy.
Requires LazyLib and MagicLib.
items.description:
A weapon mod that introduces area defense missiles that behave like the RIMs with the coordination under the Aegis Combat System of the US Navy.
Requires LazyLib and MagicLib.

Features:
AEGIS Baseline 10 hullmod and Radar Intercept Missiles.
Custom weapon and missile AI script to recreate the Aegis Combat System.
Killing one track with one bird. No more salvoing missiles even when there's only one incoming missile.
Layered area defense with SM3, SM6 and ESSM.
Intercept artillery shell with C-Dome.
Bonus: Stealthy AGM-158C LARSM, datalink guided BGM-109 Block Va and more.

Changelog:
`Version update v0.5.0
Update mod to Starsector 0.98a

Embedded Aegis Combat System script in to the weapons, Aegis Combat System hullmod is no longer needed for the RIM missiles to work!

Old Aegis Combat System hullmod is changed to AEGIS Baseline 10 hullmod with actual buffs

SM-6 is able to lock on to ship if air target is no longer available

Fix AAM of fighters not firing
`

Forum and download:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25807

items.summary: Finally got around to updating this lol
items.description:
Finally got around to updating this lol

A collection of mods which adds/buffs/modifies the Derelict Drones found out in the wild of Starsector. These mods should be 100% compatible with all other mods excluding major overhauls that aren't normally compatible with any other mods.

```Changelog:
1.2
Vanilla+ and New Drones+
All vanilla derelicts have a low tech paintjob if you have magiclib.
New Drones+ a couple more ships have paintjobs, and all wings will recolour if used on a low tech painted derelict ship

1.1
Vanilla+
Mothership fleet spawns reduced in size and quantity. Mod folder cleaned up. New save required for mothership changes.

New Drones+
Added 3 paintjobs if you are using Magiclib. The Dreadnought, Spirant and Rampart have gained a lowtech paintjob. I was bored lol


1.0 (for 0.98)
New Drones+
Vanilla+
I only updated the version for Vanilla+ and New Drones+ and did some balance changes (also added tags to the fortress and starfortress, need to test that though lol). Dunno about submods, I haven't touched them since... I think 0.96? :person_shrugging: ```


Mods available:
All the Domain Drones+ Vanilla
Recommended new save if not already existing. I cannot guarantee this mod will work on an existing save (Motherships won't make drone fleets on existing games).
This mod modifies Vanilla drones, increasing their stats. It also upgrades the Domain Faction and allows Motherships and Survey Ships to spawn Derelict fleets as if they were [REDACTED] Battlestations. (Does not enhance Rampart or Guardian anymore)

Download Link:  https://www.dropbox.com/s/lxqxz8w8j4zemrx/Domain%20Drones%2B%20Vanilla.rar?dl=1

All the Domain Drones+ New Drones
Should work on existing saves for newly generated Domain fleets/garrisons.
This mod adds new Domain Drones. Capital ships, Cruisers, Destroyers, fuel ships, cargo ships, frigates, wings, mining ships, carriers and a new buildable Derelict Station (with three Tiers) to colonies. Also adds proper survey ships and probes to those explorable (as a civilian ship that is bulky enough to be in battles if needed). Derelict stations can also appear as Pirate stations, these send Derelict raids (you can also buy ships from them, don't ask why (ensuring you have a longterm supply of them)). 

Download Link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xxdaflon17jhg2k/All%20the%20Domain%20Drones%2B%20New%20Drones.rar?dl=1

I also recommend DEX (if you had to choose between this or DEX, I would go DEX lol. That is better balanced, but you can do both!)

items.name: Ananke's Gift
items.summary: Hello, I have returned from my modding hiatus to bring you all a pretty small mod:
items.description:
Hello, I have returned from my modding hiatus to bring you all a pretty small mod:

Ananke's Gift as a standalone mod this time.

Well when I say standalone I mean *mostly* standalone as it does come with the other 2 bits from NAS and one or two hullmods, plus of course its own unlock mission.

In any case, if you'd like to have a shot at flying a jacked up superdestroyer that's well suited for manual play then this is the mod for you!

Note: You must complete The Gift mission from the main menu and then a start will be unlocked in the super category of Independents.

Requirements: Lazylib, Magiclib, Nexelerin

Download link: https://mega.nz/file/FHoUVbxT#3ZW3-7fmAbFuGfXLLBFM2IzNXSOr3VbcMolQ_9RmbKI
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=34870.0

I do plan to add more to this mod in the future regarding talking with Ananke and hopefully implementing a quest of some sort. Also, more generally, I'll be bringing some stuff from the former Epta into their own standalone mods in the future; the mechas from it will be releasing as a standalone soon and then takeshido the faction, this time with improved sprites, mechanics, and more fleshed out racing and race betting, will be releasing at some point after that.


Changelog:
Version 0.0.0
this is the first version so there's no "changes" as such, but if you've played Epta before then the changes from that to this are:
-Added proper dialogue to Ananke; press K while mousing over her hullmod on the ship in order to start said dialogue. There isn't a ton to it now, however, I plan to greatly expand it in the future and offer some rewards for engaging with her.
-Replaced some sounds for Ananke (some are semi placeholders)

items.description:
Astral Ascension is a mod that expands the Vanilla Colony size limits from 10 to 100. Meaning an entire Googol of people can live and die on a single Starsector world. Planets that exceed size 10 will transform gradually into new and exciting planet classes, possessing powerful bonuses until achieving the status of an **Astral World** at size 21.

Also provides the ability for the game to drop ||Omega Cores||, and can become custom administrators with unique and powerful colony bonuses. Tame the untamable, conquer the unfathomable. And remember, burn bright Starfarer.

items.name: Better Combat
items.summary:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
items.description:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
Releases:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/releases

Better combat is a mod that aims to make starsector combat more fun by modifying values, and adds a few small features. 

All configureable.
Safe to add and remove.

Compatible with secrets of the frontier
Integrated with luna lib

With default settings, ships have a much faster top speed, but take much longer to accelerate to top speed. Allong with this, the map size and weapon range is changed for longer range gameplay.

Added Features:
bigger asteroids
asteroids split on destruction
ship fragments move more when a ship is destroyed
PPT and CR reduced by ship damage(disabled by default)
Dynamic Zero Flux speed boost based on ship speed(disabled by default)

Values better combat allows you to modify:
map size
ship deployment location and spacing
max zoom out of the combat camera
how far ships reveal fog of war
weapon range & damage
projectile speed
missile speed & manuverability
missile submunition properties
fighter range & speed
ship speed, acceleration, hull, armor, shield, phase, flux, ordanance points, explosion size, PPT, bounds radius.
Phase global values

You can also modify values of particular weapons and ships using a query system.

Thanks to Liral for the map code
Thanks to Crablobab for the asteroid code
Thanks to Maelstrom for suggesting and testing features.

showcase video. Several fixes and updates have been made since then: https://youtu.be/mikU8sxLbuU

items.name: Cardinal Mode
items.summary: A very lightweight mod that simply exposes the setting "CardinalMode", which, when set to true, enables you to move your ship according to absolute direction rather than relative facing.
items.description:
A very lightweight mod that simply exposes the setting "CardinalMode", which, when set to true, enables you to move your ship according to absolute direction rather than relative facing.

Some notes on use:
* The setting is unfortunately made to override the function of your turn keys, rather than your strafe keys. This means if you want to turn your ship you have no choice but to use the "shift-aiming" option.
* I have noticed that trying to input multiple direction keys at once (e.g. to go NW instead of just N) can result in weirdly inconsistent behavior if you're not facing an absolute direction. I would strongly recommend using this with "Ship Direction Marker" by PureTilt.

A big thanks to Genir for making me aware of this setting, which is not documented whatsoever.

items.summary: `A small set of additional console commands for save file cleanup.`
items.description:
`A small set of additional console commands for save file cleanup.`

Might be able to fix your game if:
- Your game is stuttering
- You have extremely low fps
- You are unable to save
- You are crashing when hovering over certain fleets

ALWAYS save a copy before using any of the commands provided by this mod.

Try `[csmartClear]` before using the more direct deletion commands!
If you are getting the "crashing when mousing over a fleet" problem, use `[cclearModularShips]`!

```diff
Changelog: 
> Version patch, excluded some quest factions from csmartclear
> Made cSmartClear slightly more robust and less prone to murdering quest fleets
> Fixed it clearing the seeker bosses
``````diff
+ SAVE COMPATIBLE with any prior version
+ CAN be installed on an ongoing save
+ CAN be safely removed from an ongoing save
This means: The mod can be added if it was not present on game start, the update is safe to install over the old one if you had a prior version, and you can remove the mod at any time.
```

items.name: Console Commands
items.summary: An official update to console commands that overhauls the interface to feel more modern and provide additional quality of life.
items.description:
An official update to console commands that overhauls the interface to feel more modern and provide additional quality of life.

**Download**: <https://github.com/LazyWizard/console-commands/releases/latest/download/ConsoleCommands.zip>
**Forum Page**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=4106.0>
**Changelog & Previous versions**: <https://github.com/LazyWizard/console-commands/releases>

```fix
Version 4.0.0

- Complete visual overhaul of the legacy UI.
- Added command and argument autocompletion & suggestion.
- Added syntax hints for command parameters.
- Now remembers the last 30 commands, even across game restarts.
- The runcode command now displays live compile error warnings.
- Reverted the mods version system back to the original format.
- Added version checker changelog & download support.
- Added "History" command.

Keybinds

- CTRL + Backspace: open console
- Enter: confirm command
- Left/Right: move cursor
- Up/Down: Scroll through command history/select autocompletion
- Tab: confirm autocompletion

Legacy UI

- The legacy UI can still be re-enabled in "ConsoleCommands/data/console/console_settings.json".
- New features added with this version are not available in the legacy UI.

For Modders

- Added "BaseCommandWithSuggestion". Implement it to create a command with autocomplete suggestions.
- Use the "getSuggestions" method to return a list of the provided suggestions for your command.
- "parameter" tells you which parameter the suggestions are for (0 is the first arg).
- "previous" are the other arguments the user entered before the current one.
```

This, as of current, is a small combat chatter addon mod which adds chatter profiles for a few characters which I thought would be neat to have them.

But that is not the point of this Mod. My idea when making this is that I will take suggestions for characters from other media such as games, movies etc etc, and turn them into combat chatter profiles which you can use in game.

Currently it has the following characters from their respective media:
-Yharim (terraria calamity mod)
-Supreme Calamitas (terraria calamity mod)
-The Devourer of Gods (Terraria calamity mod)
-Draedon (Terraria calamity mod)
-Hornet (Hollow knight series)
-Haru Urara (Umamusume: pretty derby!)

Please note that hornet does not have any English lines and I literally just listened to a video with all her voice lines on it and tried my damn hardest to type them out. It can be a little hard to understand what she is saying.

Please let me know if you spot any grammar or spelling errors as I am not good at spotting them myself.

All credits for combat chatter go to Histadine. And thank you Mori for helping me get this working.

items.name: Dalton's Revised Arthr's Pirates but Epic 1.0.0
items.summary: Have you ever been playing starsector with a billion modded factions, but, much to your chagrin, you actually don't end up encountering their ships and fleets in combat very often, if ever? I certainly have had this happen to me fairly often while playing; I dont necessarily want to go to war with a faction just to see their ships and I don't really want to make my whole fleet based on said faction just to see them either. Plus pirates get kinda monotonous and boring to fight after a while.
items.description:
Have you ever been playing starsector with a billion modded factions, but, much to your chagrin, you actually don't end up encountering their ships and fleets in combat very often, if ever? I certainly have had this happen to me fairly often while playing; I dont necessarily want to go to war with a faction just to see their ships and I don't really want to make my whole fleet based on said faction just to see them either. Plus pirates get kinda monotonous and boring to fight after a while.

Dalton's Revised Arthr's Pirates but Epic, or DRAPE for short, fixes these issues by adding a small script to the game that hijacks pirate fleet spawns and gives them a chance (60% by default, though you may alter this change in the mod settings) to instead spawn as "pirate" versions of existing faction fleets (This means theyre appropriately as Dmodded as pirates normally are and are actually considered a member of the pirates faction).

This is the first version so there may be bugs, however, I tried to make sure that any "special" pirate fleets (ie, fleets with important npcs or restricted ships, that are connected to a quest, or that are otherwise important) will be left unaffected and that only playable factions can be selected for replacement fleets so as to maximize compatibility and immersion. I do plan to expand this mod in the future with features like faction agnostic "themed" fleets (ie, all high dp frigates, or all SO ships) as optional replacements and factoring in the location in the sector for determining which faction gets used, however, this is just an initial release just to have it out there and make sure it works. Special credit to highly esteemed modder Arthr for the original APE (and yes, before you ask, I did get permission from him to make this). Please DM me directly if you find any bugs or think a faction should be added to the whitelist.

Requirements: Nexelerin

Download: https://mega.nz/file/Me5wnK7I#eZMBzreBJZcZ1HFUD9mjoUuuM3vn2Z8-GbqAu0AWk5c

items.name: Dedicated Repair Equipment & Improvised Refinery | v0.0.1
items.summary: 2 small mods that add their respective hullmods.
items.description:
2 small mods that add their respective hullmods.

### Dedicated Repair Equipment
Ship with this hullmod can aid in repairs of a single other ship within fleet.
Increases repair speed, but not CR recovery speed.
While target is repairing/recovering CR - the recovery supplies cost will be reduced.
Drains metals while active proportional to target recovery cost.
Can not be installed. Built-in on Salvage Rig.

To prevent hullmod from activating - disable repairs on Salvage Rig or mothball it.

### Improvised Refinery
Install an Improvised Refinery onto the ship. The Refinery can inefficiently convert Ore into Metals.
The conversion speed is based on CR and number of ships with hullmod within fleet. Having nanoforge in cargo also influences conversion speed and efficiency.
A logistics hullmod. Can only be installed on Capital class ships. Unlocks when player gets Makeshift Equipment skill. Can be randomly found in derelict structures.

Updates (effectively) in real-time.
Also adds the player ability to toggle refinery on/off.

DM me for bug reports & feedback.
-# Or if you want to make the currently missing hullmod icons.

Both mods have LunaLib integration and are safe to add/remove from the ongoing game.
-# **But please make a separate save before removing or adding mod. This is still BETA...**

**Download:** https://github.com/Heniker/Starsector-Mods/releases

items.name: Demand Indicators
items.summary: `Indicators showing excess or shortage directly next to the commodity icon`
items.description:
`Indicators showing excess or shortage directly next to the commodity icon`

This mod adds small icons next to commodities on a market to show if they have excess or shortages, making it easier to identify worthwhile trading opportunities at a glance. It's terrific QOL.

Initially proposed by ParrotParrot.

```Changelog:

```Changes in 1.2.1:
Changed Petard:
- speed from 130 to 120
- refit from 20 to 28
- OP cost from 15 to 18
- Greatly reduced the firerate of its launcher.
The Petard was intended to be a slow priority target firing slow priority missiles. The firerate used to be high enough to form a barrage of what were essentially slow homing hammers. Now the bomber can be intercepted early (if you actually launch the required firepower at it to take it down) and interrupt the launch. Was also a bit too cheap for what it did.

- Buffed Wasp(P) wing size from 3 to 4.
The wing did not have really enough impact in my eyes. Perhaps an extra bomber will help?

items.name: Domain Explorarium Expansion
items.summary:
An in-development mod focused around the Domain Exploration Derelicts, the green droneships you fight early in the game... and also the Abyss apparently. Currently adds about 60 new automated ships and several types of derelict fighters to the game that are hopefully worth actually adding to your fleet. 
```Version 0.0.23
items.description:
An in-development mod focused around the Domain Exploration Derelicts, the green droneships you fight early in the game... and also the Abyss apparently. Currently adds about 60 new automated ships and several types of derelict fighters to the game that are hopefully worth actually adding to your fleet. 
```Version 0.0.23
-Added 16 New Weapons to the derelict faction, which can occasionally appear in pirate or independent fleets
-Added the Keep, a massive derelict dreadnought armed with a powerful spinal cannon.
-Added the Foxhole, a powerful frigate that really wants to be good late game.
-Significantly nerfed the Mirage and removed Phase Anchor from its default variant. I am so, so sorry.
-Resprited and rebalanced numerous ships, including but not limited to:
    -Arsenal- Reserve Deployment replaced with Crash Assembly, which spawns a Rampart.
    -Evergreen- (now named the Monolith) looks very different, but mostly functions the same.
    -Dreadnought- Armor value reduced to 1200 to be in line with vanilla content and reduce Damper Field-induced impotent rage.
    -Castra- Is now less Legion, and more Pegasus, exchanging fighter bays for two additional large hardpoints. Armor value reduced to 1200 for parity with Dreadnought.
    -Marche- Firing arc reduced on the large ballistic mount to be more in line with the Manticore. Removed from combatforsmallfleet spawning pool.
    -Probably more, I forgot to write these down as I did them
-Also most of the fighters look different (hopefully better) now.
-Fixed some issues with built-in hullmods. If semiautomated ships don't count as automated at this point I will be mad.
```
Can this mod be added to an existing save?
 YES! And you will *not* miss any content by doing so.

Is this save compatible with previous versions of this mod?
 YES!

The player can hire their own Executive Officers from the Dustkeeper Contingency at their Holdout Forgeship.
items.description:
This mod is a plug-in for the Second-in-Command mod by Lukas04, implementing an Executive Officer aptitude for the Dustkeeper Contingency faction from Secrets of the Frontier by Inventor Raccoon. The player can hire their own Executive Officers from the Dustkeeper Contingency at their Holdout Forgeship.

The Dustkeeper aptitude focuses on combining automated ships with human crew, gaining more automated ship points depending on the amount human-officered ships you have in your fleet.

This mod should be fine to add midgame, but Executive Officers will only spawn at the start of each month so depending on the date in game you might need to let time advance a bit before they'll appear.

items.name: EHM: Experimental Hull Modifications (0.97a Hotfix)
items.summary: Fork of lyravega's Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.97a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624> and pantsmode.
items.description:
Fork of lyravega's Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.97a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624> and pantsmode.

Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
 
**FOREWARNING**
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. ~~Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.~~
In addition, this version of the mod **WILL NOT** be supported by lyravega, Wisp, or myself. If you find bugs with this version, please do not report them. Lyra is currently working on refactoring the entire mod from the ground up for its' next addition, and so, cannot assist with fixes on this version. This version **WILL NOT** be compatible with the next version of EHM as a result.
If you understand that in full, feel free to download.

Hull Modifications: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
â€¢ Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
â€¢ Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
â€¢ Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
â€¢ AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

Hull Modification Categories: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
â€¢ Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
â€¢ Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
â€¢ Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

Slot Shunt Categories: May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
â€¢ Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
â€¢ Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
â€¢ Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
â€¢ Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

Mod by Yogurt Fox, Translated by Myco
Require Lazylib/Graphiclib/Magiclib

https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/Eridani_Combine/releases/download/1.0.3.6/EridaniCombine1.0.3.6.zip

v.1.0.3.6 also requires latest ver of BoxUtil  (1.4.9)
https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/BoxUtill_Temp/releases/download/0.98-1.4.9/BoxUtil.zip

A small faction mod adding a high tech faction 

Previously part of the Eridani-Utopia Terraforming Corporation. Fed up with the EUTC leadership's inability to address pirate raids and hostile competition and takeover from Tri-Tachyon Corporation,some departments of the EUTC formally split from its parent corporation after the  Warlord Leonis' invasion of Kapteyn Starworks. These departments absorbed some disparate remenant of the Ko-Combine and formally renamed itself the Eridani Comine. Following the Combine's formation, it kept a low profile under the cover of the first AI War - its diplomatic influence diminished, and its area of control carefully limited. All this is to cover for the extraction and analysis of precious UAC and Domain Era relics.

Situation changed after the first AI war, the Eridani Combine, having developed its own self-sufficient industry and shipbuilding industry, proposed a collaboration with the weakened Persean League. While hiding the domain tech under its control, the Eridani Combine is able to use those tech to project enough power and maintain enough defensive fleet and stations to ensure that it cannot be exploited by Persean League 'membership'. In exchange, the Combine provides survey, transport, escort, and research support to obtain the league's support against hostile competition from Tri-Tachyon and Hegemony tech-inspection. At least the name of the Persean League will cause any potential belligerent to reconsider any rash actions.

Rumor suggest that the Eridani Combine's break with its parent corporation was in of itself a set up by certain trans-sector mega corporation (such as the Tri-Tachyon Corp).  The breakdown of the EUTC under hostile takeover and vicious competition was always part of the plan. Nevertheless, the Eridani Combine, reborn from the ashes of EUTC was not only able survive in the violent sector politics after the collapse, but to thrive with the help of the relic tech under their control.

The Combine's fleet features fairly high quality high-tech ships with clearly defined roles. It relies on small amount of faction weapon and vanilla high-tech weapons to fulfill their fleet roles. Some hullmod of the faction support fighting with high flux and comes with a unique time-flow support frigate, allowing the fleet to also be capable of incredible burst damages - but it is up to you to decide to how command them.

## Current Version : 1.8.6 - Save Compatible

Inspired by Extra Systems Reloaded, Exotica Technologies offers an RPG element to Starsector that makes your ships AND enemies harder, better, faster, stronger through upgrades and exotics! These upgrades do not take OP or hullmod slots! Each ship has a limit to the number of upgrades they can install so choose wisely! However, as upgrades get more complex and specialized, they tend to consume more resources and even demand special items found through research stations and mining stations!

items.name: Expanded Core Worlds [1.0.2] (0.98)
items.summary: I've created a mod that add nine new star systems around the core worlds, expanding several faction's world count and market size, and adding some lore and historical depth to the new systems of civilized space.
items.description:
I've created a mod that add nine new star systems around the core worlds, expanding several faction's world count and market size, and adding some lore and historical depth to the new systems of civilized space.

**Achean**
A resource rich system, its worlds joined the early Persean League, Wayland providing its industry and shipbuilding to the fledgling league, rivaling Kazeron.

**Burkut**
A militaristic star system, notable for the major military base on Yel Ata.

**Gun Ana**
Significant system for the old Kayra Polity, like the rest of it, taken over by the Hegemony.

**Hergest**
Located near Westerese, notable for the major Persean world Culhwich, a lush world which was easily terraformed, and sports a large population. Culhwich was once targeted by Pathars similarly to Mairaath, but they relocated their Atropolis before the attack, and thwarted it.

**Hephaestus**
Falling under the sway of the Luddic Church due to proximity to Canaan, the system is heavily integrated with the wider Church's economy.

**Koyash**
Once the home of a post-collapse interstellar polity, the system and the entire polity was subsumed within the Hegemony.

**Omikami**
Formerly a Tri-Tachyon system before the First AI War, the Luddic Church assaulted and capture the system, claiming the systems industry for their own.

**Tranquility**
A system controlled by all sorts of malcontents and brigands, being either pirates or Pathars.

**Wukong**
A critial production center, the colonies here have heavy corporate influence and power, second only to Hybrasil itself.

*Total Markets and Size added*
- Independents gain 6 markets size 29 across 6 star systems
- Persean League gain 5 markets size 26 across 2 star systems
- Pirates gain 5 markets size 23 across 5 star systems
- Hegemony gains 4 markets, size 20 across 3 star systems
- Tri-Tachyon gains 2 markets size 13 in one star system
- Luddic Church gains 2 markets size 12 in two star systems
- Luddic Path gains 2 markets size 10 in one star system

**Forum Link**
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=33911.msg493818#msg493818

```

v1.0.2
- fixed a crash issue with Jaydee Piracy
v1.0.1

- fixed version checker
v1.0.0 stable release version
```

items.name: Experimental Hull Modifications 0.8.7HF2 (0.98a Hotfix)
items.summary: Fork of <@259007154286100481>'s Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.98a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624>  and pantsmode.
items.description:
Fork of <@259007154286100481>'s Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.98a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624>  and pantsmode.

Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
 
# FOREWARNING
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.

In addition, this version of the mod WILL NOT be supported by lyravega or Wisp. I am NOT a coder, and therefore am NOT experienced with fixing Java bugs. If you find major issues with this version, please only report them to **ME**, pantsmode, and I will attempt to fix them. Lyra is currently working on refactoring the entire mod from the ground up for its' next addition, and so, cannot assist with fixes on this version. This version WILL NOT be compatible with the next version of EHM released by Lyra as a result.

I *MAY* create a fork of this mod (with Lyra's permission) that has changes that I find might be valuable. This version is *NOT* guaranteed to be save-compatible with the hotfixed version, is *NOT* guaranteed to work, and may *NOT* even release at all.

**If you understand that in full**, feel free to download.

Hull Modifications: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
â€¢ Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
â€¢ Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
â€¢ Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
â€¢ AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

Hull Modification Categories: Will become available immediately
â€¢ Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
â€¢ Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
â€¢ Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
â€¢ Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

Slot Shunt Categories: May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
â€¢ Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
â€¢ Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
â€¢ Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
â€¢ Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
â€¢ Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

items.summary: Hey there John Starsector! I'm Lightning Dog and I have one question and *one question only!*
items.description:
Hey there John Starsector! I'm Lightning Dog and I have one question and *one question only!*

# AI CORES???



We here at Lightning Dogs Bad Ideas Emporium have a brand new  product just for you! F-TAPS! 

Have you ever wanted to jam an illegally obtained Omega Core into a Radiant to create untold horrors wrought by your hands? Do you want to make an army of alpha core Defenders and start the third AI war?? Would you like to shove the alien mind of a Tesseract inside a Lumen and commit Horrible War Crimes against a Luddic Relief Fleet with the literal incarnation of their devil?

F-TAPS!

Our brand new F-TAPS protocols utilize alien intelligence in little robots to tell the AI points system to go FUCK ITSELF! That's right! Fuck itself! By utilizing a nuclear approach to dealing with an anthill, you too can shove a giant AI core in a capital and have it at full combat Readiness!

Our scientists have called this a "Terrible Idea" and a "Clear cheat mod" and a "Violation of ethics" but I told them that they were FIRED IMMEDIATELY and threw one of them down the stairs!

Is a new mod with new AI cores dodging the effects of a settings altered Quality Captains and still invoking AI points? Fuck them! Shove in our trusty F-TAPS protocols and it'll run like a fresh build! Even if you don't use QC, this can still remove the ever annoying "balance" of the AI Points System so you can go to Jangala and commit HIGHLY VISIBLE WAR CRIMES WITH ROBOTS!

Disclaimer: F-TAPS is a cheat mod and disables a full balancing system. Use at your own discretion. Remember, Starsector is a single player game and should be experienced however it is fun to you.

Do you like playing with Second-in-Command? Good. Do you struggle to count up to whatever number of Atlases you are casually fielding in your fleet? Me too. Then this mod is for you (and me, I guess).

If you have ideas for other useful items to show in that window, ping me.

items.name: FleetBuilder
items.summary: Help with easily managing fleets by providing tools to copy, add, and save; fleets, officers, ships, variants, and more.
items.description:
Help with easily managing fleets by providing tools to copy, add, and save; fleets, officers, ships, variants, and more.

Save Transfers: Save and load; all your ships, officers, cargo, blueprints, relations, player stats, etc. Works even with disabled mods.

Copy and paste ships and officers to and from your clipboard with simple hotkeys.

Copy fleets, such as your own, with a single hotkey to later spawn them into the campaign, replace your current fleet with, or share them with others.

A custom autofit menu for the refit screen with unlimited slots that stay between saves.

A clickable filter in the fleet screen that lets you type in keywords to filter for that specific ship you want.

This mod is made with the intention to be as non-intrusive as possible. Anything that visibly adds to or changes base game behavior is disabled by default, and will need to be enabled in the mod settings.
As a utility mod, this mod can safely be added/removed mid-save.

```0.9.1 indev Notes:
- changed Octocorallia bounds so it's easier to switch between it and the Orchestria in refit screen
- fix: Ecrevisse ship system did not apply force to targets properly, also increased cooldown
- updated Freitag Control Suite hullmod text to better convey drone mechanics to the player
- fixed the Sesarma hullmod logistics hullmod mismatch
- fixed multiple cases in which autofire control would not function correctly
- PD Drones will no longer get stuck in an infinite loop of starting and landing on the mothership
0.9.0c Release Notes:
- fixed a Null Pointer Exception in main mod plugin
0.9.0b Release Notes:
- fixed a crash due to mousing over the Monofilament Tow Cable Hullmod
0.9.0a Release Notes:
- slightly increased repair power of repair drone
- OMM no longer replaces any vanilla sound files
0.9.0 Release Notes:
- modular drone weapon mounts now almost indistinguishable from normal mounts with all the group functionality like auto fire
- targeting lasers will now only appear for the selected weapon group making it easy to identify which weapon drones are controlled by the player
- Octocorallia defense plattform carried into battle by Orchestria can now be customized
- after the Octocorallia has been deployed once during combat the platform and Orchestria need to be repaired at a port to make it deployable again
- updated some sprites
- swapped sprites for Shield Drones and Repair Drones
- Repair Drones now will only take off if any targets in range are in need of repair
- bug fix: Sesarma deco overlay was not properly removed if the ship was destroyed
- the mod now replaces the following vanilla sound file: sabot_srm_fire_01.ogg. I will try to think of a different solution that does not replace vanilla sounds.```

Before the great collapse, the Persean branch of Tri-Tachyon initiated an unprecedented project with the support of "core member" whose name are now unknown: By using the AI Core's ability to simulate and evolve, they seek to skip the trial and error process in the militarization of cutting edge technology, and instead create prototype that mounts the latest tech that can be deployed directly to the battlefield. Currently the white series focus on support drones and radical fighting style while the black series focus on steady pushes and ability to hold the line. https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/Gamma-Legion/releases/download/v0.8/Gamma_Legion_UNGP.zip

**Features**
Adds a faction of derpy  and cute Gamma Cores that fights with infantry with customizable loadout supported by APC and tanks.

**Lore**

As a half baked AI core, the Gamma Cores are the most derp amongst its banned compatriots within the Persean Sector.

Countless Gamma cores are given as minor holiday gifts to various officials of various factions, used as gift or black market currency, or diplomatic gifts between factions; Even so, the Gamma core is still the icon of the AI core ban - even if it did nothing wrong.

Gamma isn't as smart as Alpha, or as driven as Beta. Gamma just want to live normal life. The officials - Hegemony's - various restriction and actions aimed to please luddic believes lead to the death of countless gamma cores...

Tri-Tachyon corporation also used Gamma by overloading them like animals, and brain washed countless Gamma to serve aas their security or outpost computers...

Finally, the Gammas decided to rise up.

Unite for a better tomorrow! The dream of libertea for all Gammas shall be realized!

items.description:
A simple portrait pack, made from concept art and game assets from different IPs, edited into one grounded package that hopefully remains compatible with the vanilla aesthetic.

https://github.com/ThunderCTA/Grounded-Portrait-Pack/releases/download/TheBin/Current.Selection.2.png
No art was made by me, all credit to the original artists. All I did was cobble some cool looking art into portraits. I used GIMP to edit everything.



Added a massively streamlined process for adding new material, figured out how Version Checker works (I hope), added more portraits and edited the existing ones to look better. Added pack design post to forums for detailed changes.


> Changelog - 1.1.0
> 
> - Now 45 Portraits, added mostly from Dead Space and Cyberpunk, up from 26
> - Edited existing portraits to look better
> - New naming conventions for better sorting and future-proofing
> - Standardised faction seperation for better continuity and additional future-proofing
> - Version Checker enabled *correctly* for TriOS, etc.


Special thanks to [Vexlia Artemiss](<https://bsky.app/profile/vexlia-artemiss.bsky.social>) for their kind words as well as Chozo being the inspiration with their [Battletech Portrait Pack.](<https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21932.0>)

items.name: Halo HomeSystems
items.summary: `Adds 3 factions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.
items.description:
`Adds 3 factions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.

COMPATABILITY 
 -Is compatible with Nexerelin.
-NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ORIGINAL OR EXPANDED UNSC MOD.

FEATURES:
The Covenant is a high tech and late-game faction to the game to the south east of the core worlds comprising 5 planets. Ships all have high flux cap and dissipation, but Covenant weapon flux usage is correspondingly high, take care when using these weapons on other craft, but have low(ish) armour and hull. EVERYONE HATES THE COVENANT.
Ships have a very high cost, default ships tend to accumulate flux quickly-ish even when firing and not taking damage.

The UNSC is a midline mid-late game faction northeast of the core worlds comprising 4 planets and 2 stations. Ships all have at least 1 axial ballistic shield-breaking MAC and love missiles and ballistic weapons. Especially hates the Covenant, and has actual relations with other factions unlike the Covenant.

The Ancients are high-tech and late-game (is there a pattern here?) series of hulls, fighters and weapons. They don't have a faction yet so their ships will spawn with Remnant fleets, albeit with a lower chance.

Stations:
The UNSC and Covenant have their unique stations that they use, and can be built by the player if` ||your rep with the faction is friendly or better||.
`
HULLMODs:
- Shield with code taken from Star Wars mod (I hope that's ok)
- Hullmods from original UNSC mod.

Assets taken from UNSC mod by AppleMarineXX and expansion by StargazerRJL mainly for weapons and some Covenant ships.
Sprites taken from Halo wiki and free-to-access artworks on Artstation by Jared Harris (most sprites from here).
Other sprites made using AI (since I can't art).`

`Download (just requires the most recent one, older vers for those who want it): `https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1EjgjwhRUI16mDH7XR8maKqCeOUtYLZ0q?usp=drive_link
`Forum:` https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28804.msg423601#msg423601

items.name: Hiver Swarm
items.summary: Hiver Swarm is a non player enemy AI faction designed to be aggressive invaders and can colonize systems. An insectoid race that uses high tech bio-cybernetics to grow their living ships. Their home world is found in deep space and their relations range from inhospitable to hostile for all factions. Their exclusive living hull designs (seen below) allow them to regenerate their hulls in combat and to be tougher made than the average factions' making them a challenge to fight. They use custom made drones, energy pulse weapons and missiles but have been known to use captured Corvus ships.
items.description:
Hiver Swarm is a non player enemy AI faction designed to be aggressive invaders and can colonize systems. An insectoid race that uses high tech bio-cybernetics to grow their living ships. Their home world is found in deep space and their relations range from inhospitable to hostile for all factions. Their exclusive living hull designs (seen below) allow them to regenerate their hulls in combat and to be tougher made than the average factions' making them a challenge to fight. They use custom made drones, energy pulse weapons and missiles but have been known to use captured Corvus ships.

They are vengeful toward the player and will become hostile on sight, you have been warned.

The mod comes with multiple optional files in the ZIP with instructions on what they do and how to enable them on the forum page as well as in a file named README in the ZIP.

items.description:
**Brief Summary:**
-Mini-mod. Two ships. One weapon. Custom starts to start off with Sakers and Super Sakers. That's it.
-Requires ArmaA and its dependencies.

RC5 changes:
-Super Saker LPC now exists.
-Mod renamed. Acronym stays the same (sorry in-game bounties, I forgot you existed when I was making this mod)
-I've _finally_ figured out shield efficacy values I'm happy with.
-Logistics tuned. Upkeep costs reduced but also now more expensive to purchase.
-Ship values tuned to make them faster, but also a bit squishier. 
-I haven't updated this since like 2022 so I make no promises regarding any hypothetical balance.

items.name: ISAF Mini-Mod - RC0.98
items.summary: It's been a couple of years since I've touched anything related to Starsector, until I built a new PC and re-installed it on a whim. After tweaking a few lines of text to make sure it still works with 0.98, I thought I'd just drop the files in here in case anyone out here still wished to add some Ace Combat-flavoured unbalanced protagonist fighter energy to their game, especially in light of AC8's announcement.
items.description:
It's been a couple of years since I've touched anything related to Starsector, until I built a new PC and re-installed it on a whim. After tweaking a few lines of text to make sure it still works with 0.98, I thought I'd just drop the files in here in case anyone out here still wished to add some Ace Combat-flavoured unbalanced protagonist fighter energy to their game, especially in light of AC8's announcement.

**Brief Summary:**
-Mini-mod. Two very silly starfighters. One weapon. Custom starts to start off with Sakers and Super Sakers. That's it.
-Requires ArmaA and its dependencies.
-The last time I was around, I don't think TriOS was a thing. I have no idea how this project interacts with it.

**~~RC5 ~~RC0.98 "changes":**
-Super Saker LPC still exists.
-Mod renamed. Acronym stays the same (sorry in-game bounties, I forgot you existed when I was making this mod)
-I've finally figured out shield efficacy values I'm happy with.
-Logistics tuned. Upkeep costs reduced but also now more expensive to purchase.
-Ship values tuned to make them faster, but also a bit squishier. 
-I haven't updated this since like 2022 so I make no promises regarding any hypothetical balance. ~~This note is ESPECIALLY relevant today~~

items.name: Illustrated.Entities
items.summary: `Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`
items.description:
`Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`

Adds images to all vanilla planets, a way to change them, 500+ AI-generated illustrations to choose from for your own colonies, and allows you to edit and add descriptions to your own planets with an in-game UI.

VRAM-Impact is around 70 mb during normal gameplay because the mod only loads images that you look at. 
However, it cannot un-load them, so VRAM use can be up to 250mb depending on your actions. Restarting the game will clear the image cache.

```Changelog:
1.2.b
Adjusted - Version Number (wow!)
1.2.a
Fixed all the problems with images not getting saved or overwritten, proper handling for orbital stations, and some crash fixes.``````diff

items.name: Java 21 - 1.2
items.summary: This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.
items.description:
This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.

Install instructions and full details of changes made are on the github page. If anyone wants to try this, I would love some feedback on if it makes Starsector run better/worse and if you get stuttering. Message me on here or post it as an issue on Github.

```
Changelog:
1.2
- Initial support files for mac and linux
1.1
- Fix for missing opens in vmparams preventing some OSs from saving games.
1.0 
- Initial release
- May stutter without increasing fps in settings.json, increasing fps will use more cpu.
```

FAQ: 
-Why Java 21? It is the currently released version.
-Will it work with older javas? It could but not currently.
-Will it work with newer javas? Untested, but probably until verification is mandatory.
-Will it work with Linux? Probably? The only thing stopping it would be if the vmparams stuff is different, like a shell script or something. I don't have linux so poke me if it doesn't work out of the box.

Instructions: https://github.com/git-blame-me/StarsectorJDK21

items.name: Keyboard As Mouse - An Accessibility(?) Mod
items.summary: This mod is built on a sort of library I'm referring to as True Input Faker, which it uses to generate fake mouse events (and possibly fake keyboard events in the future) by injecting itself between Starsector and the LWJGL game library it's built on.
items.description:
This mod is built on a sort of library I'm referring to as True Input Faker, which it uses to generate fake mouse events (and possibly fake keyboard events in the future) by injecting itself between Starsector and the LWJGL game library it's built on.

Mostly a proof of concept, this mod is a simplistic "accessibility" mod that allows using the keyboard to control the in-game cursor. This includes using the keyboard for:
* Left clicks
* Right clicks
* Mouse movement
* Scrolling
* Click-and-hold/drag

This isn't entirely ergonomic, and there are still some quirks/bugs (notably, basically all input except mouse movement, scrolling and clicks will not be processed when an inventory item stack is selected).

However, strictly speaking, everything in the game that requires a mouse can be controlled via the keyboard with this mod, even the combat layer though it's extremely difficult to do so. There's also plenty of overlap between the default keybinds I've chosen and the game's keybinds, though those can be reconfigured fairly easily.

Requires LazyLib.
Optionally depends on LunaLib for editing keybinds.

Source: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/true-input-faker>
Download: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/true-input-faker/releases/download/0.0.1/true-input-faker.zip>

items.name: Leading Pip
items.summary: This mod adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.  If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group, and the acceleration and max speed of rocket-type missiles.
items.description:
This mod adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.  If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group, and the acceleration and max speed of rocket-type missiles.

Highly customizable, including various display modes (combined vs. individual pips, for instance).

items.name: Lightning Dog's Super Conversion Hullmods
items.summary: Are you tired of ships not being playerbait? Are you exhausted at seeing things "finely balanced" to the point they're boring? Would you, maybe, just maybe, like to give that Onslaught (XIV) Manjets on top of it's burn drive? NOW YOU CAN!
items.description:
Are you tired of ships not being playerbait? Are you exhausted at seeing things "finely balanced" to the point they're boring? Would you, maybe, just maybe, like to give that Onslaught (XIV) Manjets on top of it's burn drive? NOW YOU CAN!

Includes four hullmods that take colony items and a considerable chunk of your ship's OP to make it a monster. Currently Included are The Starkiller/Overlord Flux Jets Overhaul hullmods, safety overrides on crack that also paste Plasma Jets/Manjets onto your small ships/large ships, respectively; the Iron Collar Armor System, an armor ovehaul and shield shunt stuck through a Pristine Nanoforge to make the largest slab of steel you've ever seen, and the Hexchain Electronic Warfare Network, where you sacrifice an Alpha Core to the ECM/Missile mines.

More may pop up when I figure out how I want to super a Carrier and a Shield Ship.

Mod commissioned from Mayu; they did all the work and are *big cool every time.*

items.name: Lobster cruiser
items.summary:
I've played the game several time and always found myself avoiding cruiser class ships because their use seem suboptimal. So I decided to create the ship collection which I would love to use in my own play-throughs with the following constraints in mind:
1) Ships must be fun to pilot
items.description:
I've played the game several time and always found myself avoiding cruiser class ships because their use seem suboptimal. So I decided to create the ship collection which I would love to use in my own play-throughs with the following constraints in mind:
1) Ships must be fun to pilot
2) They should perfectly blend into the game
3) Building them should be quite straight forward, while still offering some room for experimentation
4) Ships need to be balanced 
5) Cruisers should have a nice progression and age well with s-mods and more experienced officers

As a result I've created a Lobster ship lineup: 

Download: https://github.com/cat-person/starsector_lobster_ship/releases/latest/download/LobsterCruiser.zip
Forum post: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28835.0

Feel free to share your thoughts and suggestions by filling out the survey: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfQVetSiY64UYSXQMRgHxpRH4x-5T0yePQmu2OGYSzpN3GGtQ/viewform

Graphicslib dependency replaced with BoxUtil 

UNGP rules adjusted/renamed
Chaos Armament renamed "Chaos Arsenal" (I think it sounds better)
Charge Lance (& Integrated version) reworked into "Chaos Flail": flux-free(!) but expensive weapon with deeply unreliable output

Arc Field hullmod renamed "Phasebolt Field" and buffed in various ways
Other small balance changes

https://www.mediafire.com/file/vauehsxw71lei0b/Mayasuran+Navy+12.0.0+RC1+FIXED.zip/file
12.0.0 RC1
-Elongated the Gyrfalcon for one extra medium on each side.
This should double down on the whole broadside thing! : )
-Adjusted Rhea's hull integrity from 9000 to 15000, dissipation from 900 to 1200
-Mokarran Shield Arc from 270 to 300, Shield efficiency from 1.0 to 0.8, system changed to infernium from accelerated ammo feeder, manuverability stats changed to match Skysplitter, center of mass moved forward
The Mokarran should basically be a bigger version of the Sarrisophoroi, the manuverability changes will be very interesting
-Added Sprint PD DEM Missile
-Added Sprint PD Missile Pod/Array
So the small version is a DEM PD missile, the medium and larges are regular anti-missile missiles. Hope you enjoy!
-Adjusted Sweeper SHotgun damage from 50 to 100 per shot, flux per shot to 100 from 50.
I noticed some very bad performance as an anti-armor gun, therefore this buff should solve all the issues it has.
-Added Dragonfire RC (Remote control) Pod to the Skysplitter (M).
-Added Crawler Autocannon
-Adjusted Mark IX Rotary to 300 damage from 200, Flux/second from 200 to 300.
So these Autocannons for Mayasura are meant to be high damage. This means they can also punch through armor in a pinch.
-Added in Sidekick
This is a uzi type weapon that you can get for your large ballistic slot for a pretty cheap amount of OP.
-Orchard Burst size from 2 to 4

items.name: Mnemonic Utils
items.summary:
A collection of quality of life improvements for exploration. Each feature can be individually turned on/off via 
LunaSettings. Can be added to/removed from ongoing campaigns.
items.description:
A collection of quality of life improvements for exploration. Each feature can be individually turned on/off via 
LunaSettings. Can be added to/removed from ongoing campaigns.
Requires LunaLib and LazyLib.

Features:

**Mnemonic Sensors**
Marks known sensor signatures with a circle, making it easier to identify that a sensor blip is just 
a cargo pod full of metal that you left behind rather than some shiny loot or hostile fleet.

**Gate Markers**
Indicate systems that have a gate with a marker on the star map (when not in Starscape view) to make route-planning easier. Thanks to <@163467166484660224> for the icon sprite!

**Trash Disposal**
Removes low-value commodities, such as ore, from the loot screen when your cargo bays are close to full. 
Fully customizable via LunaSettings.

**Grid-less system maps**
Remove the grid from system maps, making it easier to spot things. Feature was pitched and implemented by <@581474784517292037>, many thanks for contributing it to this mod! 

**Garage for Rent**
Adds a bar event to player-owned colonies that lets you store your fleet. While parked, non-quest fleets can't interact with your fleet, you cannot move and supply usage is reduced. This is intended for passing time. Saving while your fleet is parked is not recommended. Thanks to <@705163319736139886> for sponsoring this feature!

Please provide feedback if you encounter any issues!

For more details please check the readme: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/mnemonic-sensors?tab=readme-ov-file#mnemonic-utils

Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/mnemonic-sensors/releases

items.name: More Combat Terrain Effects
items.summary: REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB, MAGICLIB
items.description:
REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB, MAGICLIB

Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.
Currently implemented:
```Magnetic field - Reduces weapon range, fighter range, missile maneuverability/guidance, vision range, and adds a small chance for missiles to have guidance scrambled.
Slipstream - Force SO on all ships, fighters, and MISSILES, (venting allowed but with reduced effectiveness, for things like excelsior), slowly passively generate hardflux.
Nebula (DISABLED BY DEFAULT): Nebula clouds reduce weapon range, vision, speed, and disable zero-flux boost while inside of them.
Deep hyperspace: Spawn nebula clouds. Hyperstorms will cause these clouds to zap anyone who draws near them, periodically, with a very powerful EMP bolt.
Black Holes: Drags all entities in combat towards the black hole, and increases time dilation of all ships.
Pulsars: Pushes all entities in combat away from the pulsar, reduces shield stats (efficiency, more upkeep, emp arc pierce chance), slowly generates hardflux, randomly EMPs ships, and charges all projectiles with a flat bonus to EMP damage.
Meson Field (More Planetary Conditions): Normally increases non-missile weapon range and vision range by a moderate amount, but in storms significantly increases all weapon range, wing range, system range, and vision range.```

Additionally, adds combat effects to campaign objectives. Fight near your comms relay to get bonus CP regen!

**Safe to add and remove from saves.**

Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/releases
Repo: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/tree/master
Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567.0

items.name: Nightcross Armory Corporation
items.summary: https://github.com/YukiMonsai/nightcross-armory/releases
items.description:
https://github.com/YukiMonsai/nightcross-armory/releases

This is a faction I've been working on for some time. I first started modding back in 2019, before going on hiatus and coming back around 0.97, at which point I found out to my amazement that my source code *mostly* still worked!

Contains:
- one capital, three cruisers, three destroyers, and two frigates. Generally high tech with light armor, high movement speed, high flux capacity, but relatively low flux dissipation, offset by a universal hullmod for shielded ships that reduces flux costs when shields are off for a high risk/reward playstyle. They also lose zero-flux bonus when they sustain hull damage, to make them less frustrating to play against them when they have long-ranged weapons.
- 5 fighter LPCs (still trying to figure out fighter balance in general)
- About 30 or so factional weapons, including 3 types of missiles and a bunch of energy, synergy, and hybrid types. Energy weapons generally deal less damage with worse efficiency than most energy weapons, but longer range. The beams are the opposite--more damage than common beam weapons, but less range.
- One modular hullmod (Plasma Aggregator)
- A star system with independent/pirate markets including special submarkets that sell NCA gear (since they don't have any official market)
- Graphicslib integration (normal maps only), plus fancy lights and doodads.

items.name: NiteLib v1.1.0 [Update I]
items.summary: QOL library mod to no longer search and write out string id's.
items.description:
QOL library mod to no longer search and write out string id's.

This utility mod allows fellow modders to use "id-finder" classes to no longer have the need/requirement to manually search for vanilla strings or id's, as I personally found it to be a hassle as well as finding out that in the already existing "Planets.java" and "StarTypes.java" there are variables that, make no sense being there.

The reason for making this was a personal need for consistency, and since I use it in my own upcoming mod(s) I thought why not upload this one already as it so far won't receive any updates soon unless I suddenly think of something new to add or someone else has any suggestions of what I could add in the realm of data retrieval of string id's or other variables that otherwise need to be manually put it.
## Changelog 
```yaml
UPDATE v1.1.0
- Added: System faction booster identifiers (Comm Relay etc.)
- Added: SystemGeneratorLibExamples.java as examples for all use-cases.
```
## Save Compatibility Notice:
```
Can be added to your game as far as I know. However once used by any mod it can no longer be removed without needing to start a new save due to the save including data used from this mod.```
Forum Thread With More Info: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=29589
Direct Download For Players: https://github.com/Niteghxst/NiteLib/releases/download/Update-v1.1.0/NiteLib-v1.1.0.zip

items.name: Nomadic Survival
items.summary:
Makes exploration more interesting by adding sites to planets that allow you to perform various operations.
It's a mod about crafting the resources you need instead of returning home to restock.
items.description:
Makes exploration more interesting by adding sites to planets that allow you to perform various operations.
It's a mod about crafting the resources you need instead of returning home to restock.

It also adds a (completely optional) challenge that dramatically limits the usefulness of fuel tankers.
This makes it necessary to scavenge, steal, and craft fuel as you go.

Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26255.0>

Latest changes:
```fix
1.5.0:
- Updated for Starsector version 0.98a and Java 17
- Fixed a rare error that could occur intermittently while loading saves for some users
- Added support for specifying the minimum abundance capacity and abundance per month of operation types
- Added support for forcing operations to spawn at colonized planets
- Added support for defining specific planetary conditions as op requirements, even if they're part of a condition group
- Changed: By default, planet ops may no longer require skills to perform (to improve out-of-the-box compatibility with Second in Command)
- Changed: New operations are now created any time newly added operation types are detected. Previously this only occurred if an update to this mod was also detected.
- Improved addition of newly added operations to more closely resemble initial spawn distribution
```

items.summary:

and Food Compression) that refine resources found in mining stations, orbital habitats or from the Nexerelin mod mining feature by using heavy machinery and forges them into custom manufactured commodities that take up less space.
items.description:
A cargo space compression utility mod that adds 6 new toggle abilities (Ore Refinery,  Rare Ore Refinery,  Bio Refinery ,Volatiles Refinery, Fuel Compression 
and Food Compression) that refine resources found in mining stations, orbital habitats or from the Nexerelin mod mining feature by using heavy machinery and forges them into custom manufactured commodities that take up less space.

I  envision this mod as a space saver and the conversion ratio stays the same with the bonuses applied from gantries and nanoforges, only the amount used and made is increased not the overall value. I have balanced the output to be as near to the input in value and all new custom commodities are effected by market demand valuation using their base commodity demand. Note: The mod can be installed during a saved game but cannot be uninstalled during one due to the custom commodities.

items.name: Orky Sector
items.summary: *An orky starsector mod by Myco and Miko*
items.description:
*An orky starsector mod by Myco and Miko*

A Mod that brings Orks from the 40k universe into the Persean Sector in a semi vanilla-friendly manner.

**0.621  Update** Save Compatible with 0.61+, not tested for earlier versions

**Lunalib now requried!**

**Download Link:**
0.98 ver - 0.621
https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/Looted_Sector/releases/download/v0.621/Orky.Sector.-.En.0.621.zip

Arma Addon - 0.98
https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/Orky_Sector_Arma_Addon/releases/download/v0.1/Orky.Sector.-.Arma.Addon.zip

Older ver available on github if needed
**Dependencies:**
Lazy Lib 
Magic Lib 
Graphic Lib 
Lunalib

Forum Post:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=29956.0

**Features**

A Mod that brings Orks from the 40k universe into the Persean Sector in a semi vanilla-friendly manner. This mod adds currently adds three ork factions (Death Skull/Evil Sunz/Bad Moons) with a series of both looted vanilla vessels and more original constructions, together with a corresponding set of Orky Hullmods, Weapons and LPCs. Some of the orky arsenal and ships will also be available to the pirates.

The faction focuses on generally ramshackle ships that favors high speed, brutal close quarter combat and burst damage. (As any Evil Sunz will tell ya, Going fast and Krumpin' stuff iz da best!)

Many weapon and hullmods having powerful or strange effects but also potentially deadly downsides. The ork's strange psychic ability improves the combat ability and reliability of ships in great numbers, making their otherwise ramshackle warship more effective in great swarms. 

Overtime, we look to adds additional ships, weapons, and factions based on the other Ork clans into the mod.

**Some Design Thoughts**
Turns out translating a bunch of mod gets one interested in trying to do some modding of their own. As a long time warhammer fan and ork player almost two decades, trying to bring the Orks to the Sector seems like a great excuse towards my limited spriting skills place to start!

There have been some excellent junker ship styles on the forums, and I thought to take a slightly different approach by focusing on the diversity of both fighting style and paintjob provided by the various Ork Clans in the setting, as a result this mod will be a bit more focused on bringing that aspect of Orky Kultur to the sector.

This is a Starsector mod first and foremost and I will not be strictly adhering to Battlefleet Gothic and 40k lore, and there will be some liberty in how I inject some proppa orkiness into the game, but I do hope you can find some good ol' orky fun within. This is our first starsector mod so any feedback and comment are appreciated as well.  ðŸ˜„

**Credit**

Co Author: Miko for various ideas, arts, sound and codes help that made this mod possible. 

CJY4312/Savemedlay/Ajimu/Riptide/Hanliu/Tim for various coding question help and answers. 
Selkie/Alfonzo/Shenqiang/Yogurt Fox/Shadowlight for feedback and sprite guides. 
Tartï¼ŒWisp and Vayra for their modding and spriting guides.
Shoi for use of Arma code for reference and the excellent framework

Mayu for reference of subsystem codes.
Starficz for the Armor Module codes. 
Alfonzo/Nia/DR for code references.
Savemedlay/Homejerry99/Yakris/Hanliu/Shenqiang/Fufufox/Yougurt Fox/ Sir Hartley for sprite and code reference from their mods.
Originem's Celestial Mount Circle for various references for campaign set up
Diamond for test mission

CJY4312 for drill SFX and script reference.
Savemedaly for bubble sprite.
Helmut and Diamond for sprite used as basis for asteroid ships.
Yogurt Fox for Portrait touch ups. 
Ceres for banner arts

Scythe and Sanfen for balance testing, design suggestion and feedback.
Boomboomf22/782ï¼ŒHuanyin, Eyu and avanita for testing and feedbacks.

Alex for making the wonderful game that is starsector and various vanilla asset used this mod.
Gamesworkshop for the  Faction Banner. 

And everyone else at Starsector Modding QQ and USC Modding for helps!

items.name: Pirate Mini Mod
items.summary:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.
items.description:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.

This is a mod meant to make pirates more unique, unhinged, and ambitious. As of now changes are simple but I plan to evolve the mod over time as I learn or get help.

items.name: Privateering - Commission Overhaul
items.summary:
A simple overhaul to faction commissions.
The goal of the mod is to add a few more features to commissions while making them feel less "passive" overall.
items.description:
A simple overhaul to faction commissions.
The goal of the mod is to add a few more features to commissions while making them feel less "passive" overall.

**Latest Download**: <https://github.com/Lukas22041/Privateering/releases/latest/download/Privateering.zip>
**Forum Post**: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=33914

**Commission Rebalance**
Vanilla commissions scale by level, with the formula being 20000 + (5000*level) , maxing at **95k** credits per month.
This mod reduces the basic pay to a measly non-scaling **15k** credits per month.
The catch is that certain maintenance costs, like supplies and officers, now have **50%** of their upkeep covered by your faction.

**Requisition Bonds**
Requisition bonds are a new resource. They are accquired when fighting fleets hostile to your commission faction.
A bond is equal to 500 credits, **but can only be spent by meeting with your commission supervisor.**
The supervisor is a new NPC which has several options for spending bonds like custom production, hiring mercs and repairing d-mods.

**Favorability**
The mod adds a new major event, called Faction Favorability.
As you support the faction, you gain more favor with it, resulting in being rewarded with slight bonuses.

```diff
-Not compatible with AoTD - Questions of Loyalty 
-Works fine with other Ashes modules.
```

items.name: Quality Captains
items.summary:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection.
items.description:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. 
Every skill has been carefully curated for the the best features from every game version. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft. 
- Every skill is balanced against all the others and the choices you make will be based on how you want to play.
- Skills don't change their power based on your fleet size
- Also makes ECM and Navigation battle effects way more fun.
V1.5 introduced a **perk system** with milestones that your character automatically unlocks as they progress through the story. These milestones include powerful QOL features and most of the effects are completely fresh to the modiverse. 

V1.6 incorporates a few of the latest skill effects in 0.97, but the best part is **none of the +/- raw damage effects** are included. Enjoy Starsector at its **best**, with the full texture of the game. 

**Enjoy! Download is below ** or through the thread.

Direct DL: https://github.com/Dal-041/QualityCaptains/releases/latest/download/Quality.Captains.zip
