items.name: Radiant Prototype & Guardian Prototype
items.summary: Had to repost this as i didnt know it wasn't in the discord anymore and also the forum download link keeps breaking.
items.description:
Had to repost this as i didnt know it wasn't in the discord anymore and also the forum download link keeps breaking.

**Ever wanted to fly a Radiant? well now you can!**

This mod adds a separate Radiant that has a bridge built on to it, it comes with a blueprint, it has the Automated ship hull mod removed so the player can fly it.
It is still 60dp to field and 500k to build.

Regular High Tech Version (blue) will spawn in Tri-Tachyon Fleets VERY RARELY
Adds a Ballistic LowTech version that will spawn in Luddic Church and Hegemony Fleets VERY RARELY

There is two more versions of the radiant included. Both come with blueprints and have 5 system charges instead of 3, they also have built in auxiliary thrusters
These are 65dp to field 500k to build.

ChangeLog-
V1.2 Updated to .96a
V1.1 - Updating the mod to V1.1 will Breaks Saves
       - Updated ship sprites with a command bridge in the back of the ship.
       - Added LowTech looking Radiant with Ballistic mounts
       - Both Black Colored Sprites had DP lowered from 75DP to 65DP
       - Regular Blue Radiant will now spawn in Tri-Tachyon Fleets VERY Rarely.
       - LowTech Ballistic Radiant will now spawn in Luddic Church and Hegemony fleets VERY Rarely.
-------------------------------------------------------
**Ever wanted to fly a Guardian? well now you can!**

This mod adds a separate Guardian that has a bridge built on to it, it comes with a blueprint, it has the Automated ship hull mod removed so the player can fly it.
It is 80dp to field instead of the normal 40dp because its keeping its autoforge and will be WAY stronger in the players hands, also its 1.5mil to build.

ChangeLog-
1.3- Added 3 new variants of the Guardian
* Full Energy variant 60dp 1mil to build
* Full Ballistic variant 60dp 1mil to build
* Full Missile variant 160dp 3.5mil to build

1.1 updated mod name to Guardian Prototype from "Human Guardian"

Credits for both mods:
Yunru- For making the mod
YuiTheModder- For doing all the sprite work.

items.name: Random Weapon Collection
items.summary: Adds a few ships and weapons I came up with.
items.description:
Adds a few ships and weapons I came up with.  

If you have a good idea for something I should add, let me know.
Balance feedback is appreciated.
Feel free to ping me.

## Contains: ##
## Ships ##
Egret- Midline capital carrier very similar to the Heron
Onslaught (B)- Onslaught variant with a beam TPC.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Conqueror- Midline battleship, fast but very poor rear arcs.  Comes with 2 fighter bays.
Javelin- Midline cruiser with AAF.  Main armament is 4 medium ballistics.
Polaris- Midline battlecarrier with reloading Harpoon launchers.
Viper- Midline frigate with AAF.
Barrage-Capital ship made out of station parts.  Slow, but heavy firepower.
Viking -Missile frigate
Warhawk- Very mobile cruiser, based on the Falcon. 
Hurricane-  high tech frigate with Terminator drones.
Vulcan-  cross between the Onslaught and Conquest.
Triumphant-  broadside capital ship with heavy armor.

## Weapons ##
Devastation- Large slot HE ballistic weapon.   Will show up in mercenary fleets occasionally.
Mjolnir Heavy Cannon- Triple-barrel Mjolnir, good luck finding something with the flux to use this well. 
Autopulse Beam- Designed as a shitpost, is just an Autopulse Laser that was turned into a beam weapon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Plasma Beam- Similar to the Autopulse Beam, but based on the Plasma Cannon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Tachyon Accelerator- Projectile variant of Tachyon Lance.  Does not pierce shields.
Light Mjolnir- Single-barrel Mjolnir, fits in medium slots.
Heavy Positron Cannon- Hybrid large weapon.  Probably needs more balancing.
Positron Cannon- Hybrid medium weapon.  
Piledriver Heavy Railcannon- Large kinetic ballistic. 
Harpoon Missile Battery-Large slot Harpoon launcher.
Phase Beam Battery- triple phase beam in a large slot.  High damage output, bad range and slightly less flux efficient than the standard Phase Lance.
Flash HVM- Very maneuverable missile with a relatively short lockon range.  Great against lighter ships, and comes in small, medium, and large sizes.
Onager Cannon- Fragmentation cannon, good fire rate but ineffective against armor or shields.
Hellfire Mortar- Deals heavy damage if it manages to hit.  If.

## Wings ##
Wildcat- DEM bomber
Solace- Energy "bomber"

Can be added mid-playthrough and should function correctly if done.

items.name: Remove Trash Ships
items.summary: A very simple mod that reduces the player faction's `hull_frequency` for `base_bp` ships to 0.1.
items.description:
A very simple mod that reduces the player faction's `hull_frequency` for `base_bp` ships to 0.1.

Basically, once you acquire a blueprint package or two, default ships will almost never appear in your fleets unless you manually prioritize them.

Ships like the basic kite, hound, etc. might still appear if you only know one or two packages. That's because they belong to a category your fleets need and might not have have an alternative for. (Shuttles, tankers, cargo ships, combat freighters, etc.)

Safe to remove from your save*. ~~The game will load the value from default player faction file (which is to say, no actual value at all, putting these ships on even footing with all other blueprints).~~

Full controller support for Starsector. Currently supports Xbox 360, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and Steam Deck. Campaign support is nearly complete for the most common UI's, but for late-game stuff like colony management UI's, don't expect much. 

Changelog:
``` - Added support for character sheet tab
 - Added support for fleet tab
 - Added support for Refit tab (incredibly basic, mostly just a mouse emulator)
 - Tweaked support for crew/cargo tab so that navigating from it to the adjacent tabs works
 - Added support for map tab (mostly a mouse editor, but it does support toggling sector/system view)
 - Added support for the intel tabs (including support for the main Intel, planets, and faction sub-tabs)
 - Added support for the Command tab (same as Refit currently, just a mouse emulator)
 - On the main campaign view, added support for selecting ship abilities/hotkeys, the current ability is highlighted with a yellow reticle, and you press B to activate the selected ability.
 - Added support for various message boxes that show up throughout the game, for instance the one that shows in campaign view when supplies run low.
 - Tons of small little bugfixes that I can't hope to list```

items.name: Shackles Garrison[XXVII] v1.1.0
items.summary: Add a mid-tech battle group. Having some vanilla-like ships. Having some special faction weapons, but all of these are build-in their ships.
items.description:
Add a mid-tech battle group. Having some vanilla-like ships. Having some special faction weapons, but all of these are build-in their ships. 

Starsector Mod by Yisic/Diling
Proofread by Mycophobia

Requires Graphic Lib/Lazy Lib/Magic Lib/Nex

```Lore```
XXVII - Shakeles Garrison
Shackles Garrison is comprised of the remnants of the XXVII Battlegroup, disillusioned with human rule after being left adrift for an extended period of time after the Collapse, seeing themselves as abandoned by the rest of humanity. Their arrival in the Sector was originally marked by a willingness to collaborate, but the geopolitically volatile environment of the Sector caused them to be embroiled in significant conflict with both Tri-Tachyon Technology and the Hegemony. These conflicts resulted in the annihilation of the Garrison's capital planet and significant fleet losses, forcing the faction to retreat to a small star system outside of the Core Worlds.

The net effect of these conflicts was to transform the Shackles Garrison from a disillusioned, somewhat cynical, but fundamentally collaborative faction with a decently-sized military force into a civilization driven almost exclusively by revenge. Specifically, a cold, patient, seething determination to exact vengeance on those who ultimately killed billions of their people, after they had arrived in the Sector with cooperative intentions. For now, they were weak, beaten, unthreatening - but they would bide their time, marshal their forces, sharpen their blades - and then there would be hell to pay.

It will be better if you start your new run after you finish all XXVII missions. Because those missions will give you some reward. 

``Newest Ver is: v1.1.0
``
```Download```
Github(English version): https://github.com/dilinganye/XXVIIBattleGroup_EN/releases/tag/Shackles_Garrison_V1.1.0

items.name: Shark Utility Console v1.0.0
items.summary: Have you ever wondered how to find the exact ship that will suit your needs? Or a weapon with very specific requirements/parameters?
items.description:
Have you ever wondered how to find the exact ship that will suit your needs? Or a weapon with very specific requirements/parameters?

worry no more. my utility console brings two new commands:
**findships** - used to find ships that match certain criteria
example: `findships large ballistic > 2` or `findships { large ballistic > 3, cargo > 800, frigate }`. read the help for it, it can query by any (and every) parameter.
**findweapons** - used to find weapons that match certain criteria
example: `findweapons { large, beam, damagetype = he }` or `findweapons { large, missile, range > 4000 }`. read the help, it can query by any (and i think every) parameter. except damage. or OP.

do try to break them. please report commands which **should** have worked, but didn't. ofc, do try to fix the command yourself first, but the syntactic parsing could be fucked up somewhere.

https://github.com/RkShaRkz/Starsector-IntelliJ-Template/releases/tag/release-utilityconsole-v1.0.0

bugreports welcome. here or github. if reporting to github, make sure to specify it's for utilityconsole, since the repo is used for most of my mods.

items.name: Ship Browser 1.2
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.2/ShipBrowser1.2.zip
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26261.msg390257#msg390257

items.name: SpeedUp
items.summary: ***Warning:** We __strongly recommend__ setting your frame rate cap in data/config/settings.json to **at least 120** to avoid AI and hit detection issues!*
items.description:
***Warning:** We __strongly recommend__ setting your frame rate cap in data/config/settings.json to **at least 120** to avoid AI and hit detection issues!*

Ever wish the game would go by quicker while you're flying your lumbering Paragon up to the line of battle?  Ever wanted to push "fast forward" while your fleet mopped up the remnants of an enemy fleet?  Ever wanted to speed through a trivial Derelicts fight?  This mod is for you!

Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  You can also press the caps lock key to toggle fast mode at your leisure.  The B button toggles the slow-down effect of phase systems.

The following are *NOT RECOMMENDED* for pitched battles due to causing problems with AI and hit detection: F3 applies a 6x multiplier, and control-capslock causes the game to run in as-fast-as-possible mode.

Controls are fully customizable by editing SpeedUp/data/config/SPEED_UP.json.  You can even set custom time scaling factors on separate inputs, if you like.


```Version 1.2.2 (April 7, 2025)
- Updated for Starsector 0.98a-RC7
- Improved the calculation for calculating dynamic speed multipliers

Version 1.2.1 (March 31, 2025)
- Updated for Starsector 0.98a
- Fixed a logical bug preventing dynamic changes in speed multipliers```

items.name: Station Augments
items.summary: ***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments AND SA_genSpecialContent COMMANDS) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***
items.description:
***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments AND SA_genSpecialContent COMMANDS) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***

Adds station "augments" which allow you to modify your orbital station. While not as expansive as hullmods, this collection will still make stations just a bit more engaging.

Augments can be find by salvaging and at markets, and are an uncommon find. They do NOT dilute the loot pool, instead adding more loot in total. Augments can also be obtained by destroying a station with augments.
Augments are also applied to NPC markets, including modded markets.

The entire augment system was designed with other mods in mind, meaning other mods can create their own augments and apply augments to their own markets without a hard dependency.

Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=30583.0
Repo: https://github.com/nikothedude/Station-Augments
Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/Station-Augments/releases/

items.name: The Hagan Protestants (Beta/in need of playtesting)
items.summary: A big old faction mod I've been hammering away at on and off for about a year now that's finally ready for some proper playtesting.
items.description:
A big old faction mod I've been hammering away at on and off for about a year now that's finally ready for some proper playtesting.

Features:
- 28 Ships
- 2 Fighter wings
- 12 Weapons
   +1 (Built in only)
- 2 Hullmods
   +2 (1 Built in only and a commissioned crews hullmod)
- Full Nexerelion support
  Diplo profile, corvus mode, weapon/ship/wing mining values and all
- Commissioned crews support
- 1 System w/ three planets
  Verified via the modverse map to be in a unique location
- and critically, 1 test mission equipped with all the included ships so you can get a feel for them without even starting a new game

The elevator pitch I'd use to describe the faction before it's even finished goes a bit like this:
- Lore wise: Is a luddic church colony abandoned by said church during the second ai war, only narrowly saved by a hegemony relief fleet (I intend to package this event as a mission w/ the final mod) but not after years of their system being besieged by drone ships forced them to get creative industrially and in terms of their doctrine.
- Gameplay wise: Funky mixture of high and low tech that I find fun. Lots of ballistic, hybrid, and energy hardpoints splattered throughout ~6 rough categories of ships.  Generally being pretty strong and good quality if bought from the faction but appropriately expensive.   

Is almost complete, it only needs the ship and system descriptions written which I'd like to do after someone other than me's played with these ships to hopefully get more fitting descriptions.
Feedback is not only appreciated but highly encouraged, please ping me in the appropriate channel or dm me with any comments or complaints (I'm mostly interested in collecting opinions on the ships doe ngl)

items.name: The Second Battlegroup
items.summary: The Second Battlegroup is an elite line of ships that can be found as derelict outside of the Core Systems (Like XIV Legion). But for gameplay purposes, their blueprint can also be found individually.
items.description:
The Second Battlegroup is an elite line of ships that can be found as derelict outside of the Core Systems (Like XIV Legion). But for gameplay purposes, their blueprint can also be found individually. 

Their combat doctrine is "Adamantium Lance" which focuses on using overwhelming firepower to break through the enemy lines. They usually emphasize large, frontal weaponry while ignoring point defence, and some ships have slightly modified weapon arcs to perfect their job.

Their Battlegroup bonus is quite similar to the XIV, but the bonus and penalty are all increased. Overall, they are stronger than XIV ships. Due to the change in weapon systems, they usually cost 20-25% more DP compared to their vanilla counterparts and cost 3x as much (XIV ships cost 1.75x). Auxiliary ships have lower bonuses and less radical restructuring, so they only cost 1.5x as much.

items.name: Tinyverse - The Wanzer Age
items.summary:
With the introduction of Diable Avionics into the sector and their military successes thanks to reintroducing the long abandoned technology of Wanzers, giant piloted mechanized robots capable of fighting both in-planet and out in the vacuum of space, showcased that it was time to consider the era of dominance of the spaceship and fighters had come to an end.
Factions all over the sector have scrambled to bring back old, forgotten relics out of the dusty hangars where they had been forgotten. Others have used their ample monetary resources to acquire Wanzer blueprints and schematics from both legal and more illicit means, and others have straight-up used their vast production powers to jumpstart their Wanzer development programs. A new arms race has begun.
items.description:
With the introduction of Diable Avionics into the sector and their military successes thanks to reintroducing the long abandoned technology of Wanzers, giant piloted mechanized robots capable of fighting both in-planet and out in the vacuum of space, showcased that it was time to consider the era of dominance of the spaceship and fighters had come to an end.
Factions all over the sector have scrambled to bring back old, forgotten relics out of the dusty hangars where they had been forgotten. Others have used their ample monetary resources to acquire Wanzer blueprints and schematics from both legal and more illicit means, and others have straight-up used their vast production powers to jumpstart their Wanzer development programs. A new arms race has begun.
Far from the core, mysterious forces noted these developments, and machines of eras past awakened in response. Binary messages spread across the sector's edge with one order: create a response, and new unspeakable things crawled out from dark shadows in the abyss.
The age of the Wanzer had begun.

Content:

This mod adds a large variety of Wanzer frames wings to all vanilla factions for both players to fight and utilize! It also adds unique Ace pilot Wings that can be found as rare bps.

- 6 Mass-production Wanzers
- 3 Unique Mass-production Wanzer variants for The Diktat, The Luddic Path, and Pirates
- 2 Wanzers for [REDACTED]
- 4 Ace Pilot Wanzers, whose Rare blueprints you can find and collect!

Download here:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=32954.0

Disclaimer: 

- I suck at math, balance was tried, expect me to have failed
- I suck at English, yes, is my first language, yes, I still suck at it, expect description grammar to have been utterly butchered
- My first mod ever, if it explodes is your fault and totally not mine.
- Feedback is not only welcomed but appreciated, just please be polite, my tiny heart is sensitive and tiny

Harsh or uninhabitable worlds? Theyâ€™ll make do.

Dardan Katoâ€™s policies trying to suppress them? Not a problem anymore.

Pick what the faithful will tolerate - Mining, Tech-Mining, keep it subtle, or disable the Heavy Industry factor entirely if you want them to ignore all industrial hubs.

Thanks to LunaLib integration, you can tweak which negating factors are enforced - or turn them all off if you want the faithful to justâ€¦ get along with everything.

Your colonies, your rules, your Luddic faithful thriving despite all the things that normally wouldnâ€™t fly.

items.name: Unofficial New Game Plus 0.1.0
items.summary: ## New game cycle
items.description:
## New game cycle

1. This mod to some extent makes up for the position of the previous old mod, SaveTransfer. When a player reaches the max level, he/she can record a saving point through the UNGP menu (there is only one saving point in all saves, which could be overwritten). The saving point will save your current credits, blueprints (other than the factory), and the current game cycle number (the new save's game cycle number will be "1").
2. After that, you can start a new game. If you open the UNGP menu within 1 day, you can inherit the saving point, basing on the background you choose, inherit 0~100% of the credits and blueprints , and get extra bonus like skills, skill points and story points.

## Specialist Mode

1. From the second gamecycle, players can choose to enter the Specialist Mode.
2. The specialist mode is divided into 4 levels: Gamma, Beta, Alpha, Omega.
3. The selection rules have a maximum number of rules, which increases with the specialist difficulty level.
4. Specialist mode offers two types of rules: positive rules and negative rules.
Positive rules: consume Cost points and provide you with different benefits for the rest of the game.
Negative rules: providing Cost points to add heavy obstacles to your game
Specialist mode can only be enabled if the total number of Cost points is greater than or equal to 0 and the number of rules is greater than the specified value.
5. Specialist mode can change rules once a year, once in the beginning by default. However, the specialist level could not be changed during the game.

## Links

Download:<https://github.com/TruthOriginem/UNGP/releases/download/2.3.0-hotfix/UNGP_2.3.0.zip>
Forum:<https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=16680.0>
Source:<https://github.com/TruthOriginem/UNGP>

It was incredibly pleasant for someone to write down my lore and ideas so well on proper, gramatically and aesthetically sound English. Without him this mod wouldn't be possible!

ADDITIONS:

Vulpoids are now their own Persons!
Vulpoids characters now use their own custom class, allowing for modular portraits with configurable backgrounds, fur colors, hairstyles, and outfits!

Customizable elements are specified in JSON files, making it easy to add your own!
NOTE: This was a delicate change to implement, and there's a chance that there's bugs or mod interactions that I was unable to catch. Always back up your saves when updating mods, and let me know if you encounter anything.

A new fur color, two new hairstyles, and new outfit colors.

What it does
Expand the sector up to 300% with vanilla-friendly balance and smarter system placement.

**Key Features**
Bigger Galaxy (scalable): *Expand the sector up to 125-300% and tweak density right from the Settings.*
Realistic systems: *Efforts are made to generate systems that are as realistic as possible.
Fuel scaling: *This allows you to better adjust consumption for users who find it too difficult to reach distant locations.*
Mission timer adjustment: *This scales the mission timer based on the size of the galaxy, giving you more time to reach distant locations.*
Strange Hyperspace: regions that change storms, visibility, and travel.*
Discovery Gameplay: *Some systems start hidden; uncover them over time, earn small XP, and get clear messages. Can be turned on & off.*
More Variety, Vanilla-friendly: *More ruins, remnants, salvage and points of interest kept close to the vanilla feel.*
Huge Mod Support: *Fixed placement for 60+ popular mods so their systems land in sensible spots.*
Dark Star Content (WIP): *Void & Pulse stars with unique hazards, pulses, and probes to find.*
Storyline (WIP):* Follow the new storyline surrounding the AI faction "EidolON".*
Custom Start (WIP): *"Black Project" start with a brief introduction and a survival-focused opening with a continuing story.*

items.description:
Add a mid-tech battle group. Having some vanilla-like ships. Having some special faction weapons, but all of these are build-in their ships. 

Starsector Mod by Yisic/Diling
Proofread by Mycophobia

Requires Graphic Lib/Lazy Lib/Magic Lib/Nex

```Lore```
XXVII - Shakeles Garrison
Shackles Garrison is comprised of the remnants of the XXVII Battlegroup, disillusioned with human rule after being left adrift for an extended period of time after the Collapse, seeing themselves as abandoned by the rest of humanity. Their arrival in the Sector was originally marked by a willingness to collaborate, but the geopolitically volatile environment of the Sector caused them to be embroiled in significant conflict with both Tri-Tachyon Technology and the Hegemony. These conflicts resulted in the annihilation of the Garrison's capital planet and significant fleet losses, forcing the faction to retreat to a small star system outside of the Core Worlds.

The net effect of these conflicts was to transform the Shackles Garrison from a disillusioned, somewhat cynical, but fundamentally collaborative faction with a decently-sized military force into a civilization driven almost exclusively by revenge. Specifically, a cold, patient, seething determination to exact vengeance on those who ultimately killed billions of their people, after they had arrived in the Sector with cooperative intentions. For now, they were weak, beaten, unthreatening - but they would bide their time, marshal their forces, sharpen their blades - and then there would be hell to pay.

It will be better if you start your new run after you finish all XXVII missions. Because those missions will give you some reward. 

``Newest Ver is: v0.9.7
``

items.name: [0.97a] Combat Docking Module v0.0.6
items.summary: I'm reviving this mod with permission from the original creator
items.description:
I'm reviving this mod with permission from the original creator

This mod adds a hullmod that allows you to be able to dock with any carrier larger than a frigate. Once you lose 20% of your hull HP, fall below 40% CR, or run out of ammunition, you can turn on autopilot and your ship will navigate to its assigned carrier and land to repair and replenish.

Known issues:
-Drift if the landing happens too fast.
-Fighter Collision class break some weapons that does not target fighters.
-Refit time is very short if HP is full. (Feature?)
-~~Unknown result if the carrier retreats with the ship landed inside. Coded for, but untested edge case.~~ 
-ANY docked ship will explode if carrier retreats with ship inside
-AI pilot doesn't initialize if carrier doesn't have an LPC equipped. 06/18/2021

All credit goes to Harpuea and all code is theirs

Requires LazyLib

Download link: https://github.com/CriOwO/Combat-Docking-Module/releases/latest

Original mod link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=20415

Forum Link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=30297.0

items.name: [0.98] Show Encounter Stats v1.1.2
items.summary: Download link: <https://github.com/Seekers6967/starsector-show_encounter_stats/releases/latest/download/ShowEncounterStats.rar>
items.description:
Download link: <https://github.com/Seekers6967/starsector-show_encounter_stats/releases/latest/download/ShowEncounterStats.rar>

Forum Thread: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=34734>

Small mod that adds various info when you encounter a fleet but before deciding to engage it.

Displays information such as number of ships on each side, DP total, autoresolve strenght (Fleet Power or FP) and the estimated +%EXP bonus due to battle difficulty (using vanilla calcs). Excludes civilian ships from the number of ships and DP count, as they are not really relevant but it does count the FP they contribute.

items.name: [0.98a]Thorough System Scan (was System Wide Sensor Scan) EN translation
items.summary:
A mod that allows player fleet to scan entire star system at the cost of volatiles CR and time.
Made by Nitori_Tachyon
items.description:
A mod that allows player fleet to scan entire star system at the cost of volatiles CR and time.
Made by Nitori_Tachyon
Fossic post: https://www.fossic.org/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=15140&extra=page%3D1
Forum link:https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=32638.0
Github link:https://github.com/SaltyKarl/Thorough-System-Scan/tree/EN
 Requires both LunaLib and LazyLib
the rest is English translation of the Fossic post
# System Wide Sensor Scan

### Adds an initially available campaign ability that allows the player to perform a System Wide Sensor Scan after a number of prerequisites have been met in order to discover salvage-worthy objects in the current system and temporarily have a view of all fleets in the system .

The prerequisites are as follows:

   Fleet sensor strength of at least 1000 (Can be adjusted via LunaLib).
   Have enough volatiles in the cargo bay (see later for numerical calculations)
   Be in the scanning position of the current system (see later for definition)

Skill effects are as follows:

   -Consume a certain amount of volatiles
   -Finds and marks salvageable objects across the system
   -Temporarily obtains detailed information on the location and composition of all fleets in the system (from about three-quarters of the way through the end of the scan).
   -Player fleets are highly visible and limited in movement speed during skill activation.
   -Reduces the readiness of several ships in the fleet that provide sensor strength (see later for details).
   -Reports the **expected** number of special items (including AI cores, ship blueprints, fighter wing blueprints, weapon blueprints, ship insertion blueprints, colony industrial specials, etc.) carried by all salvageable objects in the system at the completion of the scan, which may deviate slightly from the actual value (can be turned off in LunaLib)
